intro: [WRONG START] Steles angelica, commonly known as the angel's orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family. It is a terrestrial orchid characterized by its upright, slender stems and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. Native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces white or pale yellow blooms. Its unique floral structure and ornamental value make it a popular choice for botanical gardens and orchid enthusiasts.
